fresh.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I’ll just make some fresh coffee.
The report provides fresh evidence about the way the business was run.
You’ll have to start again on a fresh sheet of paper.
fresh.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: good or interesting because it has not been done, seen etc before
fresh.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Ryan will bring a fresh approach to the job.
Let’s take a fresh look at the problem.
fresh.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: done, experienced, or having happened recently
fresh.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: There were fresh fox tracks around the hen huts.
The accident was still fresh in her mind.
fresh.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: fresh food has recently been picked or prepared, and is not frozen or preserved
fresh.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The beans are fresh from the garden.
fresh.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: fresh flowers have recently been picked
fresh.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: The kitchen is decorated in fresh blues and greens.
She has brown hair, hazel eyes and a fresh complexion.
fresh.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: if the wind is fresh, it is quite cold and strong
fresh.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: full of energy because you are not tired
fresh.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: She always seems fresh and lively, even at the end of the day.
Despite his busy day he arrived looking as fresh as a daisy (=not tired and ready to do things).
